title.narrative: Advocacy in UK and Ireland on colombian peace process and human rights - extension 2022

description.narrative: Develop public events in the UK and Irish parliament. Use verification commissions as a privilege tool for gathering information (and providing protection). Partake in advocacy meetings with Colombian authorities, and British and Irish politicians. Promoting parliamentary debates and questions.Undertake research and analysis of specific topics and emblematic cases and publish reports. Organizing public events, human rights defenders tours, fields visits and joint advocacy meetings. Respond to protection issues through letters, visits and advocacy meetings.

State institutions have become more responsive to international recommendations on human rights. Human rights defenders involved in cases prioritised by ABColombia have been protected through international advocacy and are able to maintain the scope and the reach of their work. Visibility of violence against communities in the international arena including the UK, increases and so the Colombian government will be pressured to take action. Advocacy work supporting partners in Colombia and with the institutions funding the peace process (such as United Nations and European Union) is carried out and then development practices and policies would become more inclusive. Profile of human rights defenders is raised through letters, visits, reports and advocacy meetings and so potential attacks will be prevented. Violations of communities’ rights by Irish and UK multinationals are highlighted to the embassies and their citizens, so these violations and abuses could be stopped.
